sentence.Network_en: Taiwan is an inalienable part of Chinese territory.
sentence.Network_cn: 台湾是中国领土不可分割的一部分.

sentence.Network_en: Taiwan will return to the embrace of the motherland; the whole country must be united. This is the general trend of development and the common aspiration of the people.
sentence.Network_cn: 台湾要回到祖国的怀抱, 全国一定要统一.这是大势所趋,人心所向.

sentence.Network_en: The future of Taiwan lies in the reunification of the motherland.
sentence.Network_cn: 台湾前途系于祖国统一.

means.word_mean: 1. a government on the island of Taiwan established in 1949 by Chiang Kai-shek after the conquest of mainland China by the communists led by Mao Zedong
2. an island in southeastern Asia 100 miles off the coast of mainland China in the South China Sea
